New Records: The Yankees clinched their 32nd consecutive winning season, the second-longest streak in Major League history behind the 1926-64 Yankees, who were winners in 39 straight seasons. Thirty-two straight winning seasons matches the second-longest streak in the four major pro sports, alongside the NHL’s Montreal Canadiens (1952-83).
Key Match Events: Clarke Schmidt returned from the injured list and pitched into the fifth inning, combining with Nestor Cortes on a four-hitter in the Yankees’ 2-0 victory over the Cubs.
Nestor Cortes held Chicago hitless over 4 1/3 innings in his first relief appearance since 2021.
Austin Wells knocked in Gleyber Torres with the game’s first run on a first-inning groundout.
New York added another run with an aggressive sixth-inning double steal, where Aaron Judge scored due to a throwing error.
Post-Match Reflections: Clarke Schmidt expressed confidence in the Yankees' rotation, stating, 'We have a lot of talented guys on this staff and we have a lot of depth, which is really good.'

Austin Wells commented on Schmidt's performance, saying, 'It looked the same [as earlier in the season], if not better. Really, it comes down to execution and locations, and I think that’s going to tighten up as we get further along into the end of this month.'

Nestor Cortes shared his initial frustration about moving to the bullpen but emphasized his commitment to the team, stating, 'I’m never going to back down from a challenge. I’m never going to leave my teammates out to dry. You’re always going to get my best effort, no matter if I’m happy or not.'
Manager Aaron Boone praised Cortes' professionalism and performance, saying, 'He went out and excelled at it.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Austin Wells threw out two runners trying to steal second base -- Nico Hoerner in the fourth inning and Pete Crow-Armstrong in the fifth.
The Yankees secured their first series victory since taking two of three from the Rockies on Aug. 23-25.
